alert.note: Alert for Central and Southeast Park County; South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 24 at 3:52AM MDT until May 24 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations between 3 and 6 inches. * WHERE...The Mountains of Summit County, the Mosquito Range, and the Indian Peaks, and South Park. * WHEN...Snow will continue this morning and will be heavy at times, especially in Park county. This afternoon the snow will diminish to showers, but some heavy showers are expected with additional accumulation likely. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult at times with slushy roads and poor visibility in the heavier showers. Roads affected will include Interstate 70 between Georgetown and Vail Pass and US highways 285 and 24 in Park county.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Allow extra time for travel in these areas today. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
